meanings.definition: To cover with a thin layer of gold.
meanings.sent1: She wanted to begild the picture frame to make it look more expensive.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a special technique to begild the statue for the exhibition.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous elf tried to begild his friend's shoes as a prank.
meanings.sent4: The setting sun seemed to begild the entire landscape with its warm glow.
meanings.sent5: The old clock was begilded with intricate patterns that caught the light beautifully.

meanings.definition: To give a golden color or appearance to something.
meanings.sent1: The morning sunlight seemed to begild the dewdrops on the grass.
meanings.sent2: The chef used saffron to begild the rice and give it a rich color.
meanings.sent3: The golden retriever's fur appeared to begild in the sunlight as it played in the park.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter had the power to begild even the gloomiest of days.
meanings.sent5: The autumn leaves begild the trees with their vibrant hues before falling to the ground.
